channel.title: deuteronomy on dfangx's website
channel.description: Recent content in deuteronomy on dfangx's website

item.title: Day 81, Deuteronomy 32-34, Psalm 91
item.description: Moses gives Israel a song and a blessing. In the song, it speaks of the righteousness and faithfulness of God. It also speaks of the greatness and sovereignty of God.

item.title: Day 80, Deuteronomy 30-31
item.description: Moses tells Israel that after the blessing and the curse have come to pass, then Israel will remember God, and God will bring them back from exile.

item.title: Day 79, Deuteronomy 28-29
item.description: God tells Israel the blessings they can expect when they faithfully obey him. These include blessings for their work as well as blessings for their wombs.

item.title: Day 77, Deuteronomy 21-23
item.description: Many of the laws given here have recurring themes. Their punishments are harsh so that whatever evil that had been committed in Israel can be purged.

item.title: Day 78, Deuteronomy 24-27
item.description: Laws for divorce are given to Israel, in addition to various other laws. Some laws include reminders of past experiences that Israel had with whatever the law is addressing.

item.title: Day 76, Deuteronomy 17-20
item.description: The laws that Moses recounts for Israel heavily emphasize judgement and grace. Many of these laws show how seriously God takes sin, as many of these offences are punishable by death or exile.

item.title: Day 75, Deuteronomy 14-16
item.description: Moses tells the Israelites about the laws regarding clean and unclean food again. He reminds them that they are to live in the way God commands them because they are a holy people to God, and God has chosen them as a treasured possession.

item.title: Day 74, Deuteronomy 11-13
item.description: Moses charges Israel to love God and keep the entire commandment. He goes over the blessings that God has in store for them, but also sets a curse before them should they turn away from God and worship other gods.

item.title: Day 73, Deuteronomy 8-10
item.description: Moses reminds the people to remember God. Just as how Israel witnessed God providing for them and dwelling among them in the wilderness, they are to remember God and keep his commandments when they have settled and have received the blessings of God.

item.title: Day 72, Deuteronomy 5-7
item.description: Moses presents the covenant God made with the people of Israel at Horeb (Sinai). He emphasizes the setting which the covenant was made in and the people’s reaction to it.

item.title: Day 71
item.description: God gave King Og of Bashan over to the Israelites. Thus, Israel took control of the territory of two of the Amorite kings.

item.title: Day 70, Deuteronomy 1-2
item.description: Moses recounts the Journey of Israel after leaving Mount Sinai. When they arrived at the edge of Canaan, God commanded them to go forth and take for themselves the inheritance that he promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
